com.google.gwt.search.client
Class Search

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.search.client.Search
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlogSearch, BookSearch, ImageSearch, LocalSearch, NewsSearch, VideoSearch, WebSearch
public abstract class Search
extends java.lang.Object

A base class for various types of Google searches. This class is intended to be used only through its concrete subtypes.

Nested Class Summary
static class Search.Cursor
          Tracks the results returned by the search.
static class Search.Page
          Represents one page in a search.

Method Detail

addSearchCompleteHandler

public void addSearchCompleteHandler(SearchCompleteHandler handler)
Add a SearchCompleteHandler to receive notifications when Results are created after executing the Search. This search will fire when searches created by execute(String) complete.

Parameters:
handler - The handler to add

clearResults

public void clearResults()
Remove the results obtained by the last call to execute(String).

createResultHtml

public void createResultHtml(Result result)
Regenerate the HTML associated with a Result object. This can be used to regenerate the pre-rendered HTML associated with a Result object if setNoHtmlGeneration() had been previously called on the Search.

Parameters:
result - The Result to re-render.

execute

public void execute(java.lang.String query)
Programmatically execute a query.

Parameters:
query - The search query to execute.

getAttribution

public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget getAttribution()
According to the terms of service for the Google AJAX Search API, it is necessary to display the attribution Element near search result if you are using a raw Searcher.

getCursor

public Search.Cursor getCursor()
After a successful search, this object will be populated. You can retrieve results from additional pages.

Returns:
on success, a valid cursor object. otherwise, returns null

getResults

public com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<? extends Result> getResults()
Retrieve the results from the previously-execute query. The exact types of the Results will vary based upon the subtype of Search that is in use.

Returns:
A List of Result objects.

gotoPage

public void gotoPage(int pageNumber)
After a search completes, this method allows you to fetch another bundle of search results. Applications specify which page by using the page argument. This value is then used to index the array returned by Search.Cursor.getPages() which ultimately is used to compute the value of the &start url argument.

Parameters:
pageNumber - supplies the page number of the results that the application wants. This value is range checked relative to the .cursor.pages property and no operation is performed if the page is out of range or if the underlying searcher does not have a cursor property.

removeSearchCompleteHandler

public void removeSearchCompleteHandler(SearchCompleteHandler l)
Remove a previously-added SearchCompleteHandler.

Parameters:
l - The SearchCompleteHandlerer to remove

setLinkTarget

public void setLinkTarget(LinkTarget target)
Set the target window to use if the user clicks on a displayed result's link.

Parameters:
target - The new LinkTarget for new Results created by the Search object.

setNoHtmlGeneration

public void setNoHtmlGeneration()
Invoking this method will disable Result.getHtml() method in any results created by the Search. Invoking this method will decrease query execution time if you do not intend to use pre-rendered results.

setQueryAddition

public void setQueryAddition(java.lang.String addition)
Add additional terms to any query executed by the Search. This can be used to create more specific queries.

Parameters:
addition - Additional parameters to add to any queries executed by the Search.
See Also:
Refine Search

setResultSetSize

public void setResultSetSize(ResultSetSize size)
Request more or fewer results when executing a search. This is taken only as a hint and may not be honored when the search is executed.

Parameters:
size - The desired number of results.

setUserDefinedClassSuffix

public void setUserDefinedClassSuffix(java.lang.String label)
Adds a user-specified CSS class suffix to the pre-rendered HTML provided by Results that are created by the Search.

Parameters:
label - A CSS class suffix.

setUserDefinedLabel

public void setUserDefinedLabel(java.lang.String label)
Used by SearchControl when it is used to displayed search results. This will set the group heading for the results associated with a particular search.

Parameters:
label - The label to use when displayed Results associated with a Search in a SearchControl
